block.p: CALPINE CORP., San Jose, Calif., a developer of power generation plants, said it planned to split its common stock two shares for one.
HOME PROPERTIES OF NEW YORK , Rochester, N.Y., a real estate investment trust, said it had agreed in principle to sell its affordable-housing development operations to a management team.

W. P. CAREY & CO., New York, a real estate investment and leasing company, completed the $17.8 million purchase of food distribution centers in Valdosta, Ga., and Johnson City, Tenn.

YORK INTERNATIONAL CORP., York, Pa., a maker of heating and refrigeration systems, said it would cut up to 1,500 jobs, or 6 percent of its work force, as part of a plan to save up to $60 million a year starting in 2002.
